SUMMARY: In the world of smart doorbells, Ring makes a ton of models and offers a package that has become quite popular amongst consumers. Not to mention that Ring's Video Doorbell Pro 2 is our pick for best doorbell, and the Video Doorbell 4 is the best wireless doorbell we've tested.

TITLE: Exclusive: Title, cover and details of new Trump book from Bob Woodward and Robert Costa revealed
SUMMARY: First it was "Fear," then it was "Rage," now it is "Peril." That is the title of the highly-anticipated third book about President Trump from legendary journalist Bob Woodward, this time written with co-author Robert Costa, a Washington Post national political reporter.

TITLE: First-ever water cuts expected for Colorado River in historic drought
SUMMARY: Additional cuts — each tier with worsening impact on agriculture and municipal water — are expected if Lake Mead continues to fall.

TITLE: New York man pleads guilty to posting threats against Warnock and Congress
SUMMARY: A New York man has pleaded guilty after posting online violent threats against Congress and newly elected Georgia Democratic Sen. Raphael Warnock in the lead-up to and during the January 6 insurrection, federal prosecutors announced Monday.

TITLE: The best thermometers of 2021
SUMMARY: In our search for the best thermometers, CNN Underscored tested 15. Aside from evaluating the readings, we also considered ease of use, speed of readings and other nice-to-have options, ultimately finding three thermometers that stood out.

TITLE: Former Michigan Rep. Paul Mitchell dies at 64 after cancer battle
SUMMARY: Paul Mitchell, a former US congressman from Michigan who championed Republican priorities before leaving the party over its embrace of election lies, died on Sunday following a battle with cancer. He was 64.

TITLE: These people quit their jobs during the pandemic. Here's what they're doing now
SUMMARY: Major life events -- like a global pandemic -- often lead people to take stock of their lives. And many workers are now taking a closer look at their jobs and realizing it's not what they want to be doing anymore.

TITLE: National Exercise Program Fast Facts
SUMMARY: Read Fast Facts from CNN about the National Exercise Program, the US system for emergency preparation drills.

TITLE: Andy Murray is back in the 'good books' after finding lost wedding ring
SUMMARY: Andy Murray is back in the "good books" after tracking down the wedding ring he lost when his trainers went missing earlier this week.

TITLE: Youngkin walks fine line on 'election integrity'
SUMMARY: Glenn Youngkin is trying to walk a tightrope on so-called election integrity. The Virginia GOP gubernatorial nominee, who has acknowledged that President Joe Biden's election was legitimate, is digging into his call for an audit of the voting machines used in the 2020 election.

TITLE: Explosion at mosque in Afghanistan kills and wounds at least 100
SUMMARY: A suicide blast ripped through a Shia mosque in northern Afghanistan Friday, killing and injuring at least 100 people, a UN agency said.

TITLE: Biden signs bill that will give victims of mysterious 'Havana syndrome' better medical care
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden on Friday signed into law long-delayed legislation to provide support to victims of the mysterious "Havana syndrome," a strange confluence of symptoms that have sickened diplomats, spies and service members around the globe.

TITLE: Jaclyn Moore of 'Dear White People' boycotts Netflix over Dave Chappelle's anti-transgender jokes
SUMMARY: Jaclyn Moore, writer and showrunner on the series "Dear White People," is boycotting Netflix after the streamer released Dave Chappelle's latest stand-up special, which contained a slew of jokes aimed at transgender people.

TITLE: African scientists' historic malaria breakthrough celebrated by peers
SUMMARY: The World Health Organization's decision to recommend the widespread use of a long-awaited vaccine against malaria is an endorsement of the African scientists involved in developing it, a top official in the global health body told CNN on Thursday.

SUMMARY: A New Jersey man arrested in July after a video showed him shouting racial slurs at a neighbor has been charged "with leaving a threatening note on one of his victim's cars earlier this year," as well as vandalizing the victim's vehicle, according to a news release from the Burlington County Prosecutor's Office.

TITLE: New York City to eliminate gifted and talented school program after years of opponents saying that it segregated students
SUMMARY: New York City will phase out its controversial gifted and talented student program after years of debate that the exclusive classes further segregated students.

TITLE: Wall Street isn't sweating the mixed jobs report
SUMMARY: America added far fewer jobs in September than expected, but investors didn't seem too disappointed: Stocks were flat Friday as Wall Street took solace that the unemployment rate continues to drop after the pandemic-fueled spike last year.

TITLE: Longest Serving US Senators Fast Facts
SUMMARY: Read CNN's Fast Facts about the 25 longest-serving senators in US history.

TITLE: 2 shot dead at senior living facility in Maryland's Prince George's County, police say

TITLE: Travel to the Netherlands during Covid-19: What you need to know before you go
SUMMARY: If you're planning a trip to the Netherlands, here's what you'll need to know and expect if you want to visit during the global coronavirus pandemic.

TITLE: The homecoming queen gave away her crown to comfort a grieving family and set an example for us all
SUMMARY: Nyla Covington was crowned homecoming queen at her Mississippi high school, but gave her crown to another student on the homecoming court, whose mother had passed away from cancer earlier that same day.

TITLE: Microsoft Surface Laptop Studio review: A seriously powerful and versatile 2-in-1

TITLE: US judge recommends Cristiano Ronaldo rape case be dismissed
SUMMARY: A federal judge in Nevada has recommended that the rape case involving Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo be dismissed.

SUMMARY: It's not too much to say that independents handed Joe Biden the presidency in 2020.

SUMMARY: October is peak apple season for many regions of the United States, so it's time to pick your favorite apples to make pie, tarts, crisps, sauce, butter or just to enjoy as is.

TITLE: Some children's hospitals see another surge in rare Covid-19 complication MIS-C
SUMMARY: Scientists still don't know a lot about a rare and serious Covid-19 complication that impacts children, but what they do know is that when there is a surge of Covid-19 cases in their area, MIS-C cases will typically follow.

TITLE: Must-watch videos of the week
SUMMARY: Captain Kirk cracks Anderson Cooper up with his real-life trip to the final frontier, Hamilton star sends a history teacher a message and surveillance videos across Colorado capture an "event of a lifetime" on camera. These are the must-watch videos of the week.

TITLE: 'Ted Lasso' and the great Nate debate
SUMMARY: If watching the trajectory of Nate Shelley, the formerly meek now mean assistant coach-turned-traitor on "Ted Lasso," has made you uncomfortable this season, you're not alone. Count me among those who felt during most of the season that the character Nate (Nick Mohammed) had been done dirty by a room of cartoonishly evil writers, represented in my head only by a series of shadows and occasional shots of their ghoulish hands reaching for watered down cold brews at a conference table in a dark dungeon.

TITLE: 'No Time to Die' is the most important film of the pandemic era
SUMMARY: In the nearly six decades since 1962's "Dr. No," one thing has been a constant at the cinema: Bond, James Bond.

TITLE: CDC vaccine advisers schedule meetings to discuss booster shots, vaccines for kids
SUMMARY: Vaccine advisers to the US CDC have planned two meetings in the coming weeks to discuss more Covid-19 vaccine boosters, as well as Pfizer's application for emergency use authorization for its vaccine for children 5-11.

TITLE: CDC vaccine advisers schedule meetings to discuss booster shots, vaccines for kids
SUMMARY: Vaccine advisers to the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention have planned two meetings in coming weeks to discuss more Covid-19 vaccine boosters, as well as Pfizer's application for emergency use authorization of its vaccine for children 5-11, officials said Friday.

TITLE: Trump DC hotel incurred more than $70 million in losses while Trump was president, documents show
SUMMARY: Former President Donald Trump racked up more than $70 million in losses over a four-year period from his Washington, DC, hotel, while publicly claiming that the hotel was making more than tens of millions of dollars, according to documents released by the House Oversight Committee.

SUMMARY: Steve Bannon will not cooperate with the House select committee investigating January 6, his lawyer said in an email obtained by CNN that cites former President Donald Trump's claim of executive privilege.

TITLE: 136 countries agree to minimum corporate tax rate after Ireland drops its opposition
SUMMARY: A group of 136 countries have agreed to a global treaty that would tax large multinationals at a minimum rate of 15% and require companies to pay taxes in the countries where they do business.

TITLE: Here's what having a Covid-19 vaccine for children might mean for your kids
SUMMARY: Pfizer said Thursday it's asked the US Food and Drug Administration to authorize use of a low-dose version of its Covid-19 vaccine for children 5 to 11.

TITLE: Whoopi Goldberg receives apology from Barbara Corcoran for body shaming joke
SUMMARY: "Shark Tank" star Barbara Corcoran has apologized to Whoopi Goldberg after Corcoran was accused of body shaming Goldberg on "The View."

TITLE: California makes it illegal to remove a condom without consent, an act called 'stealthing'
SUMMARY: California Gov. Gavin Newsom signed a bill into law Thursday making the state the first to prohibit "stealthing," or removing a condom during intercourse without a partner's verbal consent.

SUMMARY: How does one come up with a paranormal buddy comedy tied, in part, to the antebellum era of history?

But eight months later, they're largely responding with a collective shrug to warnings again he's taking steps to try to overturn the 2024 election, telling CNN they see no reason yet to be alarmed.

SUMMARY: The Senate was in self-congratulatory mode on Thursday night.

SUMMARY: If you're planning a trip to the Maldives here's what you'll need to know and expect if you want to visit during the global coronavirus pandemic.
